summary: This document is a series of Bureau of Prisons count sheets and inmate roster records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 10, 2019. It includes official out-count forms and unit-specific count slips, recording inmate census numbers by housing unit. The significance lies in its date—the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody—and its routine administrative nature, which contrasts with the extraordinary events of that day.

events.title: MCC Official Out Count
events.description: Routine inmate count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, recording a total of 758 inmates across various housing units.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Document date is August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at MCC New York.
The forms are routine Bureau of Prisons administrative records for inmate counts and assignments.
Total inmate count recorded was 758 across various housing units (B-A, C-A, E-N, E-S, G-N, G-S, H-A, I-N, K-N, K-S, R-A, Z-A, Z-B).

Inmate roster includes assignments marked 'SUICIDE' (e.g., E05-535L SUICIDE R, K09-026U SUICIDE OR, E06-546L SUICIDE C DR, K11-053L FS WAREHOU SUICIDE OR), which may refer to suicide watch protocols or housing designations.
The documents are official count slips requiring verification by correctional officers, highlighting standard prison procedures on the day of Epstein's death.
